pr_title: FLEX-5580: Adds location information to the kafka message.

timeline.message: FLEX-5580: Adds location information to the kafka message.
FLEX-5580: Renames some classes, fixes sonar issue.

timeline.bodyText:
Copyright on new files should mention Alliander N.V. instead of Smart Society Services B.V.
Looking further-on in this pull request it seems this is not a new file, but a renamed one (from LsPeakShavingMeasurementType).
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText:
The current harmonic enum names end in a part starting with an 'L' where the description starts with an 'I'.
Is this intentional, or would it be better to make these letters the same?
timeline.author: bvdzwet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,104 @@

+package org.opensmartgridplatform.adapter.kafka.da.application.mapping;

+import java.util.Arrays;

+import java.util.stream.Collectors;

+import com.alliander.data.scadameasurementpublishedevent.UnitMultiplier;

+
+public enum LowVoltageMeasurementType {
+    VOLTAGE_L1(0, "U-L1-E", UnitSymbol.V),
+    VOLTAGE_L2(1, "U-L2-E", UnitSymbol.V),
+    VOLTAGE_L3(2, "U-L3-E", UnitSymbol.V),
+    CURRENT_L1(3, "I-L1", UnitSymbol.A),
+    CURRENT_L2(4, "I-L2", UnitSymbol.A),
+    CURRENT_L3(5, "I-L3", UnitSymbol.A),
+    TOTAL_ACTIVE_POWER(6, "SomP", UnitSymbol.W, UnitMultiplier.k),
+    TOTAL_REACTIVE_POWER(7, "SomQ", UnitSymbol.VAr, UnitMultiplier.k),
+    ACTIVE_POWER_L1(8, "P-L1", UnitSymbol.W, UnitMultiplier.k),
+    ACTIVE_POWER_L2(9, "P-L2", UnitSymbol.W, UnitMultiplier.k),
+    ACTIVE_POWER_L3(10, "P-L3", UnitSymbol.W, UnitMultiplier.k),
+    REACTIVE_POWER_L1(11, "Q-L1", UnitSymbol.VAr, UnitMultiplier.k),
+    REACTIVE_POWER_L2(12, "Q-L2", UnitSymbol.VAr, UnitMultiplier.k),
+    REACTIVE_POWER_L3(13, "Q-L3", UnitSymbol.VAr, UnitMultiplier.k),
+    POWER_FACTOR_L1(14, "PF-L1", UnitSymbol.none),
+    POWER_FACTOR_L2(15, "PF-L2", UnitSymbol.none),
+    POWER_FACTOR_L3(16, "PF-L3", UnitSymbol.none),
+    CURRENT_TOTAL_HARMONIC_DISTORTION_L1(17, "THDi-L1", UnitSymbol.PerCent),
+    CURRENT_TOTAL_HARMONIC_DISTORTION_L2(18, "THDi-L2", UnitSymbol.PerCent),
+    CURRENT_TOTAL_HARMONIC_DISTORTION_L3(19, "THDi-L3", UnitSymbol.PerCent),
+    CURRENT_HARMONIC_L1_H3(20, "I1-H3", UnitSymbol.A),

timeline.bodyText: Copyright on new files should mention Alliander N.V. instead of Smart Society Services B.V.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText: Copyright on new files should mention Alliander N.V. instead of Smart Society Services B.V.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText:
Would it be nicer to include "source.getData().length == 0" in the check for no measurement values, or is it nicer to have this logged as the error with the unexpected number of fields.
Both log an error and return null, so it wouldn't make any difference for how the functionality is implemented.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText: Maybe it would be nicer to either just state the actual length and saying it is not one of the expected values, or mention the number of elements of both enums explicitly as expected.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText: To avoid confusion, you could use a capital L to make 1000 a long value as in some fonts 1000l may look like 10001 (or just leave it out, which would work as long as "source.getCreatedUtcSeconds()" remains a long and isn't ever changed to an int).
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText:
I can't easily see why the mapping to the measurement was changed from mapping to a ScadaMeasurementPayload to mapping to an array of ScadaMeasurementPayload elements, but I'll believe there was a valid reason.
When this array is processed by addLocationData only the first element is used.
Is there an assumption there will ever be a single element, or are later elements to be discarded?
If there should ever be a single element it may be nice to assert that (and at least log an error and possibly even return like with zero elements or a null array). If there may be more elements, but these are intentionally ignored, a comment about this may make this clear for anyone looking into this code.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

replies.bodyText: added a comment and log line
replies.author: robindenadel

timeline.bodyText:
Something seems to be special with the value 100 for feeder. It might be nice to extract this into a method with a name that clarifies what is so special about it and/or add a comment to provide some more info.
It may be that this is just a random number bigger than any feeder value would be, but then it might be nicer to just determine the int value and possibly change the signature of getBayIdentification to accept a numerical feeder value instead of a String.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

replies.bodyText: refactored it into a constant META_MEASUREMENT_FEEDER
replies.author: robindenadel

timeline.bodyText: It looks like this file contains data that had better be kept in a database. I think you mentioned something about this as being out of scope for now. (Just checking if it was about this file.)
timeline.author: bvdzwet

replies.bodyText: you are correct, it was about this file
replies.author: robindenadel

timeline.bodyText:
A number of other classes have been renamed from LsPeakShaving-something to LowVoltage-something.
Would it be better if this one was changed as well, or is there a reason this could stay as it was?
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText: Lower case l might be confusing, upper case L for long value would make it stand out a little more clear.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe this test could have a better name than "testSomeOtherPayload".
It looks like it is not just some other payload, but one that leads to a null value for the event, suggesting an incomplete or invalid payload instead of just some other one.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText: Upper case C in the name would look a bit nicer.
timeline.author: bvdzwet

timeline.message:
FLEX-5580 ~ Removes duplication in measurement to Analog conversion

Measurement values are converted to an Analog list using an Enum that
has a definition describing each position in the list of values. This
definition combined with the matching value in the measurement values
list can produce an Analog value.

The earlier implementation had a StringArrayToAnalogList converter for
each of the Enums describing the values. These changes refactor those
converters into a single class that can use any of the Enums that
matches the number of values to be converted.
